Mediterranean Grilled Chicken Salad

Jump to Recipe

Are you ready to elevate your salad game with a burst of Mediterranean flavors? This Mediterranean Grilled Chicken Salad is not only a feast for the eyes, but it also packs a nutritional punch with fresh ingredients and lean protein. Featuring juicy, grilled chicken breasts seasoned with aromatic oregano, vibrant mixed salad greens, and a colorful array of cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion, this salad is a perfect balance of taste and health. Topped with creamy feta cheese and briny olives, each bite transports you to a sunny coastal escape. Drizzled with a zesty olive oil and lemon dressing, this dish is ideal for a light lunch, a dinner party, or meal prep for the week ahead. Join us as we guide you through creating this delicious Mediterranean-inspired dish that’s not only easy to make but also sure to impress your family and friends!

Ingredients

boneless, skinless chicken breasts

For best results, marinate the chicken in olive oil, lemon juice, and oregano for at least 30 minutes before grilling to enhance flavor and tenderness. If you don’t have chicken breasts, you can substitute with chicken thighs, which will add a richer flavor.

mixed salad greens

Use a variety of greens like arugula, spinach, and romaine for a mix of textures and flavors. If you want a more hearty salad, consider adding some quinoa or farro.

cherry tomatoes

Opt for ripe, firm cherry tomatoes for the best flavor. If unavailable, substitute with halved grape tomatoes or regular tomatoes diced into bite-sized pieces.

cucumber

For a refreshing crunch, use English cucumbers as they have fewer seeds and are less bitter. If you want a bit more flavor, consider adding pickled cucumbers.

red onion

Soaking sliced red onion in cold water for 10-15 minutes before adding to the salad can mellow its sharpness. Alternatively, you can use green onions for a milder flavor.

feta cheese

For a creamier texture, opt for crumbled feta. If you’re looking for a dairy-free option, try using crumbled tofu with a bit of lemon juice and salt.

olives

Kalamata olives are a great choice for their rich flavor, but you can also use green olives or any other brined variety. If you prefer a milder olive flavor, rinse them under cold water before adding.

olive oil

Use high-quality extra virgin olive oil for the best taste. If you want to add more flavor, infuse the olive oil with herbs or garlic before using.

lemon juice

Freshly squeezed lemon juice is key for brightness. If you don’t have lemon, lime juice can be a great substitute, or you can use a splash of vinegar for acidity.

dried oregano

To enhance the flavor, rub the dried oregano between your fingers before adding it to release its essential oils. For a fresh taste, you can substitute with fresh oregano, using about three times the amount.

salt

Use kosher salt for seasoning the chicken and salad, as it distributes more evenly. Adjust salt to taste after the salad is assembled to avoid over-salting.

pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper will provide a more robust flavor than pre-ground. For a spicy kick, consider adding a pinch of red pepper flakes to the salad.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Grill

    Set your grill to medium-high heat (about 375°F to 450°F). This ensures that the chicken will cook evenly and develop a nice char.

  • Step 2: Season the Chicken Breasts

    Take the two boneless, skinless chicken breasts and season them generously with salt, pepper, and 1 teaspoon of dried oregano. Make sure to rub the seasonings into the meat to enhance flavor.

  • Step 3: Grill the Chicken

    Once the grill is hot, place the chicken on the grill. Cook for about 6-7 minutes on each side or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F. Use a meat thermometer to ensure accuracy.

  • Step 4: Prepare the Salad

    While the chicken is grilling, wash and chop the salad ingredients. In a large bowl, combine 4 cups of mixed salad greens, 1 cup of halved cherry tomatoes, 1 sliced cucumber, and 1/4 of a thinly sliced red onion. Toss gently.

  • Step 5: Slice the Chicken

    Once the chicken is finished grilling, let it rest for about 5 minutes. This helps retain its juices. After resting, slice the chicken into strips.

  • Step 6: Assemble the Salad

    Add the sliced chicken on top of the salad mixture. Then sprinkle with 1/2 cup of crumbled feta cheese and 1/4 cup of olives.

  • Step 7: Make the Dressing

    In a small bowl, whisk together 3 tablespoons of olive oil and 2 tablespoons of lemon juice. Add salt and pepper to taste. Drizzle this dressing over the salad just before serving.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I properly prepare chicken breasts for grilling?

Start by patting the chicken breasts dry with paper towels. This helps them sear better on the grill. You can also pound them to an even thickness (about 1 inch) for more uniform cooking.

What is the best way to season chicken?

A simple mix of salt, pepper, and dried herbs like oregano works great. Rub the seasoning onto both sides of the chicken evenly. You can also marinate the chicken in olive oil, lemon juice, and spices for extra flavor.

How can I tell if the chicken is cooked through?

Use a meat thermometer; chicken is safe to eat at an internal temperature of 165°F (75°C). If you don't have one, make sure the juices run clear and there’s no pink meat remaining in the center.

What are some tips for chopping vegetables like cucumber and onion?

For cucumber, slice off both ends, then cut it in half lengthwise before slicing. For the onion, cut it in half from root to stem, then peel off the skin. Make horizontal and vertical cuts to dice it easily.

How do I make sure my salad greens are fresh and clean?

Rinse the salad greens under cold running water. Shake off excess water or use a salad spinner to dry them. Fresh greens should be crisp and not wilted.

What can I substitute for feta cheese if I don’t have it?

You can use goat cheese, mozzarella, or even a dairy-free cheese option if you prefer. Just keep in mind that the flavor will change slightly.

How do I safely grill food?

Always preheat your grill and ensure it’s clean to prevent sticking. Use long-handled tongs to flip food and avoid using your hands near the heat. Keep a spray bottle of water nearby in case of flare-ups.

What is a good way to whisk oil and lemon juice together?

In a small bowl, add the olive oil and lemon juice. Use a fork or a whisk to mix them together vigorously until they are well combined. This creates a simple vinaigrette.

Can I prepare the salad ahead of time?

Yes! You can wash and chop the veggies a few hours in advance. Just keep them in the refrigerator. Add the dressing right before serving to keep everything fresh.

How do I store leftovers from my grilled chicken salad?

Store leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 days. Keep the dressing separate to avoid soggy greens.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This salad is naturally gluten-free and can be made dairy-free by omitting the feta cheese or substituting it with a dairy-free cheese alternative. For those following a low-carb diet, reduce the amount of chickpeas or omit the olives. Vegetarian guests can enjoy a similar salad by substituting grilled chicken with grilled halloumi cheese or marinated tofu, while still maintaining the Mediterranean flavors.

Pairings

For a delightful dining experience, pair the Mediterranean Grilled Chicken Salad with a crisp, chilled white wine such as Sauvignon Blanc or a light rosé. For those preferring non-alcoholic beverages, consider serving sparkling water with a slice of lemon or a refreshing herbal iced tea. If you want to add a protein element, consider serving alongside grilled shrimp or a side of roasted chickpeas for added texture and flavor.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the salad in large, shallow bowls to allow for easy mixing of ingredients. Consider garnishing with fresh herbs like parsley or mint for a burst of color and flavor. For a more substantial meal, serve with warm pita bread or a side of hummus to complement the Mediterranean theme. The salad is best served slightly chilled to enhance the freshness of the vegetables and the grilled chicken. Drizzle a bit of extra olive oil and a sprinkle of fresh lemon zest just before serving for an extra flavor boost.

Mediterranean Grilled Chicken Salad

30 min
$12
350 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

Dairy

Dietary Tags:

Gluten-FreeLow-Carb

Cuisine:

Mediterranean

Course:

Tags:

HealthyQuickGrilled

Description

A fresh and vibrant salad packed with grilled chicken, vegetables, and a zesty dressing.

Ingredients

  • boneless, skinless chicken breasts: 2
  • mixed salad greens: 4 cups
  • cherry tomatoes: 1 cup
  • cucumber: 1
  • red onion: 1/4
  • feta cheese: 1/2 cup
  • olives: 1/4 cup
  • olive oil: 3 tablespoons
  • lemon juice: 2 tablespoons
  • dried oregano: 1 teaspoon
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste
